Package chess

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, EmptyTile, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    ChessPiece is an abstract class used to represent pieces on the chess board. Chess pieces are one of the major parts of chess and so, they have various values attached to themselves. A ChessPiece object includes state information needed for different operations of chess. This state information includes:
    • Coordinates of the piece
    • Player ownership of piece
    • Identity of the piece
    • Status on being moved
    • Status to be able to be taken by enpassant
    • Status on it being attacked or not

    Author:
    Anthony Siu, Benjamin Lee

      • isLegal

        public abstract boolean isLegal​(ChessPiece[][] board,
                                int x,
                                int y)
        Parameters:
        board - the 8x8 chess board created for pieces to be placed on and chess to be played
        x - the row number of the piece, in chess terms, it is numbers 1 to 8
        y - the column number of the piece, in chess terms, it is letters a to h
